runs.comm: leg side, on a length and tucked through square off the pads
slightly back of a length, works off the pad and it roll behind square, no bat involved
length, tight line on the stumps, Warner blocks back towards mid-on
fuller, around middle and off stump, gets forward and pushes fine of mid-off for one
Finn pummels the ball into the pitch short and fast and it climbs past Finch's nose as he swings and misses
touch short of a length, angling back in off the pitch, prodded back on the off side for another single
pitched up outside off, not a half-volley but hit cleanly on the up over mid-off for four

swats across the line, top-edged and the ball loops tamely to mid-on! England have slain the beast! Everyone was expecting him to go after the bowlers again and Finch is always going to live and die by the sword. Although it was more like the pen knife this time... Maybe not quite short enough to pull and Broad gets him
gets across and defends a length ball on the stumps
gets forward and steers one through the off side
good length, around middle and off, Warner covers up in defence
again Warner goes back and across and respectfully blocks from the crease
length ball outside off, comes forward and drives away from the body through a gap in front of point for a couple
touch fuller, steps outside off and drives to mid-off
little bit short from Finn and Watson comes hard at him, swatting a top-spin forehand over mid-on, lovely clean hitting from Watto

superb bit fielding from Morgan, a direct hit from backward point and Watson is gone for all money! He was sent back by Warner, never a run there, but Watson turned like a HGV backing up to a petrol pump, dived for the crease but Morgan's throw was on target, bouncing and shattering the stumps with the bat well short
ooh, jaffa first up from Finn to Marsh, seaming and bouncing past the outside edge as the batsman poked at it
beaten again, another snorter and rises sharply just outside off, Marsh helpless
Warner isn't going to take this reclining and he advances to bosh a cross-batted swipe past mid-on for his first boundary
bit of width, stays back and cuts a length ball into the ground to point
short and wide again, gets this away behind square with a vicious thrash of the hands, excellent bat speed and the ball flies to the boundary
Broad continues to bowl wide of the stumps, Warner clatters the ball to point again
fires it wide of the off again, steered through backward point, third man covers it
three balls to Marsh outside off, three times it has zipped through and into the keeper's gloves
we do know what Warner can do and, even he didn't, so does Finn, as a length ball outside off is launched over long-off, one step and a flowing swing of the bat
better length from Finn, steps away and pats into the covers
tries to make room again, hacks across the line and gets one wide of mid-on
short and rising down the leg side, that's a wide
stays back of a length, on the pads and nudge in front of square leg
Warner dances out, tries to put Finn into orbit, throws the bat but fails to connect as it flies across him
back of a length, on the pads and it rolls away off the hip as Warner tries to glance
length ball, pushes back and it's wide of Dernbach before landing safely on the cut strip
sixer, over long-on! Too full and in the whacking zone from Dernbach, Warner seized on it and boinged the ball over the rope
pushed across, played into the off side
fiery bouncer, soars through as Warner attempts to uppercut and misses - called on height, though
slightly back of a length, worked to midwicket
length ball on middle and off, tries to hit on the up but can't get it through the covers
on the stumps, drops back and tucks one through square leg
drags this down the leg side
pushed through on leg stump, worked short on the leg side
gets forward and lofts a full ball over mid-on, bounces but wide of the fielder and reaches the rope
gets away with a long hop that Warner drags into the ground
skips out and throws the hands through a rasping drive that beats the man at cover - four more
smashed! Warner advances and slogs with impunity, there's a man at long-on but even Morgan on his tip-toes can't grab that one - six!
flatter and quicker and Warner gets hit on the body as he comes forward again
stays back and thrashes a couple through the covers from the crease
skidding on, tapped off the legs for a single through square
tossed up on the stumps, paddled through backward square to the man on the fence
turned off the legs through midwicket
lovely late cut from Warner, sitting back for to chop a slightly short ball behind point, Lumb makes a dive on the rope but the ball spins back and goes for four
short and skidding on, Warner cuts hard but gets a bottom edge, bounces up over the stumps and Buttler collects
outside off, length ball and pushed through the covers to the sweeper
slower ball, down the leg side - wide
slightly short, on the stumps, Warner was coming forward and nudges it into a gap at midwicket
back of the hand again, taking the pace off, wide of the tramlines as Marsh thinks about cutting
pulls across the line and gets one through backward square
slower ball on the stumps, Warner can only pat it into the covers
length, worked off the pads through midwicket, the man comes in off the fence and they get two
sliding down the leg side, clipped firmly but straight to the man at 45
pushed down the leg side, runs away off the pad
flat and drifting behind Warner - another wide
skidding on with the arm and Warner is struck on the pads in front of leg stump, Root appeals but probably sliding past
plays across the pad and misses
nailed this one, down on one knee and heaved out towards deep midwicket, signs of aggression from Marsh
flat and on the stumps, played from the crease into the covers
bowled him, hitting across the line again! Marsh maybe didn't need to go big again in that over but he was feeling the pressure - he missed and Root hit, England break the stand
short of a length, Warner stands on leg stump and unleashes his forearms to power this out to deep cover
full at off stump, defended to cover
a hint of swing into Bailey who clips it from off stump to midwicket
that's a cracker...after two dot balls he drives a floaty, full delivery straight down the ground
Broad responds by going short, Bailey cloths it down to fine leg with a pull and the lack of pace on the shot allows him back for a second
he's not hang around, picks up a length delivery and flicks it well over the deep midwicket rope...went with the wind, which helped it carry miles
driven through the covers, they think of a second but the throw from Wright at long-off is already on its way it
stays round the wicket, short of a length, flicked off the back foot through midwicket and they hurtle between the sticks
worked off the stumps again, this time squarer and again it's placed perfectly for a second
on leg stump, worked straight to deep square
onto the back foot, tucked through midwicket and that takes him to fifty off 38 balls

more deft placement, and quick runner, as Bailey places it through midwicket...Root tries to chase it down but neither he nor long-on can prevent the second. The run out is check - Buttler flicked the ball into the stumps - but Warner was well home
short ball down the leg side, Dernbach had adjusted to see Warner move around his crease but it's still called
slower ball, 70mph, outside off, driven out to deep cover
doesn't quite middle this as he goes over extra cover to a length delivery but it falls well short of deep cover
dragged down short and wide but it only costs a single as Bailey toe-ends it out to deep cover
sharp bouncer this time, 86mph, and it beats Warner's fierce attempt at a hook...close to a wide, actially

oh dear, Finn has made a mess of this at long-off! Warner sent a length delivery miles into the air - there's a tricky wind today - Finn called early but never looked confident and in the end was nowhere near it. Root, a better fielder, was the other man close by
gone this time! It hasn't proved costly, though. Warner slices a short delivery flat out to deep cover where Hales held the catch coming in off the boundary
drifts into leg stump, flicked to deep square
full at the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
goes for the reverse sweep, it's a straight delivery, gets a bottom edge to short third-man
he gets one! Bailey misses his sweep and (umpire) Bailey gives the decision. Didn't look dead straight. Well, that was dead straight. Hawk Eye shows hitting middle and leg full on.
stays round the wicket, worked from off stump through the leg side
uses his feet and crunches this down to long-off...reached the fielder in a split second. Still only worth one, mind
back of a length, Maxwell aims to the leg side but the ball ends up down at long-off
round the wicket, back of a length, bunted down to long-on and they get their skates on between the stumps
well bowled, another slower ball, 64mph, and it almost provides a return catch as it loops off a leading edge when Wade is through his shot early
short, wide and fairly slow...the lack of pace means it's hard work for the batsman to swing it through midwicket
gets a bit more behind this pull through midwicket
slower ball to end the over, 66mph, and Maxwell is through his shot, getting a bottom edge into his pads
and another...round the wicket, a quicker delivery skids through and beats Wade's attempt at a pull
full at the stumps, driven down the ground
steps to leg and hammers this through the off side...finds long off
lovely shot, a more controlled version of what Maxwell was trying, moves outside leg stump then goes inside-out over cover
quicker ball, Faulkner cuts it hard but picks out backward point
well bowled by Briggs, cramps Faulkner for room as it comes in with the arm and he can only push it back to the bowler
dropped in short and Maxwell helps himself to a full count over deep square-leg
this is a touch fuller, but Maxwell still pulls - and almost swings himself off his feet - this time through midwicket
that is plastered through the off side, short of a length and it sat up for Maxwell who moved to leg and slammed it over cover
now he flat-bat pulls this straight down the ground, Finn does well to get around from long-on and hands the ball to Morgan who hurls it back
this time Finn gets beaten, good over for Australia, Maxwell picks up a length delivery and lofts it straight down the ground
low full toss, Bopara lucky it only costs a single as Maxwell pings it to deep square leg
beaten first up, basically he missed his drive at a length delivery
that's the end of his fun. He flicks a low full toss straight down the throat of deep square-leg who barely had to take a step either way

what a catch! Superb from Morgan at backward point. It was a very sharp bouncer, Faulkner was in a horrid tangle as he tried to pull. Comes off the shoulder of the bat and it appeared it would fly just over Morgan, but he turned then pulled out a big leap to hold the catch
full, outside off, driven powerfully out to deep cover...perhaps not the best ball on a hat-trick
short again, angled into the body, 88mph, pulled down to long leg
full, wide, swing and a miss...an over that sealed the match from Dernbach
blimey, that's big! Finn offers up a length delivery and Coulter-Nile reminds everyone he can clear the ropes as he launches over deep midwicket. Wasn't even out of the middle!
back-to-back sixes! Is this game still on? Short this time from Finn and he pulls it over the long-leg boundary
that's brave...sends down a slower ball, back of a length, and it beats Coulter-Nile as he aims another pull
quicker this time, 87mph, and it's back-of-a-length again which beats Coulter-Nile for pace
the short ball works, down at 75mph, and it takes the top edge to short fine-leg...Finn came back very well after those two sixes
round the wicket, another slower ball, and Johnson only finds fresh air as he tries to carve it through the off side
short at the body, fended away backward of square
a full slower ball, it pings out of the middle of Johnson's bat but straight to long-on
he doesn't seem to keen to stay in line, gets a quick short delivery and is comprehensively beaten
high full toss, called no-ball for over waist height so the catch at backward point won't count...Ahmed sliced it high into the off side. Well above waist height
a yorker is dug out into the off side
banged in short again, Ahmed aims over midwicket but is beaten
slower ball to end with gets chipped into the leg side
